text: on August 21st America will experience a
rare and momentous event a total solar
eclipse is really a once-in-a-lifetime
opportunity that gets dark like twilight
and crickets will chirp birds will sing
you'll be able to look up and see stars
and some of the planets in the sky the
shadow of the Eclipse the so-called path
of totality is 70 miles wide but a
partial eclipse will be visible across
the lower 48 states traveling at over
2,400 miles per hour it will hit Oregon
at 10:15 a.m. Pacific time 1:15 p.m.
Eastern Time it slows down to 1,500
miles per hour as it leaves South
Carolina at 2:49 p.m. Eastern Time
it's a chance for the solar system to
show us some fireworks from space
it's an unmissable spectacle being under
a total solar eclipse and observing
totality is a completely surreal
experience it's a chance to see the
cosmic clockwork in action to remember
we live on a ball of rock speeding
through space it's an experience that is
odd people for thousands of years
